resources.string: All information published by Bayer CropScience is provided in good faith and is NOT a substitute for rigorous field walking in combination with advice from BASIS qualified persons. Any decisions made based on the information are the responsibility of the user. Bayer CropScience Limited and members of their respective groups accept no liability for any loss or damage resulting from the use of this turf weed, pest and disease app.
Unfortunately, Bayer cannot complete ID requests from users\n outside of UK and Ireland. We will endevour to identify\n weeds, diseases and insects in the UK and Ireland only.
You can take upto 3 different photos to\n support indentification.

Wearing the Knapsack and full
 protective clothing, measure the time
 in seconds it takes to walk 10m and
 enter the value here.
From the product label, determine the\n target volume of water in litres per\n hectare and enter the value here....

string.name: productlabelnote
string.i: Note: Volumes of water may be flexible on the product\n label. Use higher water volumes for denser canopy\n growth. If in doubt use the higher volume quoted.

string.name: alert2Ident
string.i: Please ensure the images you send area as\n clear as possible to aid identification.

resources.string:
On a dry area, holding the spray
 nozzle at a normal working distance
 from the floor, spray a band of water.
 Measure the width of the spray
 swath and enter the measurements
 in metres.

string.name: holdingspraynote
string.i:
Note: Spraying height should be 0.35 metres
 above area to be sprayed for a 110 degree
 nozzle or 0.6 metres above area to be sprayed
 for an 80 degree nozzle

resources.string:
Select the correct type of nozzle
 and pressure, as near to the target
 nozzle output is required as possible,
 using the operator handbook. Please
 enter the nozzle pressure in BAR.

Using a calibrated jug and stopwatch,
 check the output of your sprayer over a
 period of one minute. If more than one
 nozzle is fitted, check all of them are of
 same type and add together the
 individual nozzle outputs to give
 the total figure.

 Keep a note of the actual
 nozzle output

Using a calibrated jug and stopwatch, check the output from a minimum of four nozzles and at least one from each boom section.
 
 If time permits, check the output from all nozzles. 

 Keep a note of the actual
 nozzle output

string.name: calibratedJugNote
string.i:
Note: Should the output of nozzles differ by + or -5% and
 cannot be connected by adjusting the pressure, then
 re-check the measurements and calculations. If necessary,
 the next largest nozzle size should be substituted.

resources.string: Enter the actual nozzle output\n of the sprayer in litres per minute.
If your actual volume of water is within the limits set by the product label, your knapsack is correctly calibrated.
To achieve the correct water volume you must alter either your swath width or walking speed. The adjusted figures are shown below.

Please note it is not possible to achieve the recommended water volume please review the outputs from your sprayer and either alter your nozzle type or pressure to achieve the label defined output. Please re-enter your data.

string.name: sprayertanktxt
string.b: Enter the tank capacity in litres.

resources.string: From the product label, determine\n the product dose rate in litres\n per hectare and enter the value.
Calculate the area to be treated in
Calculate the area to be treated\n in square metres.
Enter the area to be treated\n in square metres.
"As carefully as possible, measure the time it takes the sprayer to travel 100m in seconds and enter the value here."

string.name: boomstep7
string.center:
Enter the output of one nozzle
in litres per minute here.

string.name: boomstep8
string.center:
Enter the number of nozzles
on the spraying machine here.

string.name: boomstep9
string.center:
Enter the width of the spray boom
in metres here.
